Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <cipi> i haven't done any work towards the arbitrage script yet :-)
no, i don't store the prices from cmc, but BarterDEX does... in ~/SuperNET/iguana/DB/PRICES... but i haven't used them and don't know the details (maybe i should)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <cipi> oh, setting up a BarterDEX node for playing marketmaker is not that much work... most of the work is maintenance for the wallets of all the coins
btw, i have a short and simple script for setting up such a node (including ERC20-support): http://pad.supernet.org/bob-erc20

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <cipi> half of the script is about compiling KMD wallet and configuring KMD and ETOMIC (for the erc20-coins) 😉

Content: [dscrd-hush] <Owe> Hey, I just want to inform you that Hush now has a proper mobile wallet! You can speak and transact freely on both Android and iOS utilising Hush network within zelcore (formelly zeltrez). https://zelcore.io/#download

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ZelTrez is not supported nor an official wallet. It concerns me greatly that it is not open source

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so Hush and this discord has nothing to do with that, and does not support it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Owe please don't spam for Zelcore in here, we don't support non-open source wallets

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Owe> Sorry for actually doing anything for Hush community but your rules. Cheers

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> It's been requested by literally any community member who expresses interest in your product to be able to examine the source code. It's not like we're hiring actors to grill you guys. The community wants open source as well. We aren't going to risk reputation and peddle a closed source wallet that may steal from users.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> @CryptoPope Welcome, I would recommend the web wallet as it's fast(you don't need to sync it) and easy to use, just remember to make a strong passphrase and write it down EXACTLY as you typed it in, also backup the private key(s) for the address(es) you're going to use in a safe place in case you misplace/misspell your passphrase. https://wallet.myhush.org/

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> <NedBGQ> you might have to fully uninstall Agama and then re-install
